title: Chapter 151 The Dancing Monkeys
content: A PRINCE had some Monkeys trained to dance. Being naturally great mimics of menâ€™s actions, they showed themselves most apt pupils, and when arrayed in their rich clothes and masks, they danced as well as any of the courtiers. The spectacle was often repeated with great applause, till on one occasion a courtier, bent on mischief, took from his pocket a handful of nuts and threw them upon the stage.
